definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Test not equal to idea, coffee and often act as my outlet wine.
sentences.chinese: 考試不如意時，咖啡便常常充當我的解愁酒。

sentences.english: He was drowning his sorrows in a bottle of whiskey.
sentences.chinese: 他借一瓶威士忌來解愁。

sentences.english: The best cure for unhappiness is to throw yourself into your work.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解愁辦法就是投身於工作中去。

sentences.english: People who drink to drown their sorrow should be told that sorrow knows how to swim.
sentences.chinese: 應該通知借酒解愁的人，悲愁不會消逝。

sentences.english: Talking things over with her would be a good outlet for you.
sentences.chinese: 有事跟她談一談，對你也許是個很好的解愁的方式。

definition: to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to enjoy a cup of wine by oneself
lit. to eliminate worry and dispel melancholy (idiom); diversion from boredom/to dispel depression or melancholy/to relieve stress/a relaxing pass-time
